SENT.plain: Dentists are aware of the extraordinary influence an active thrusting tongue can have on dental development

In the presence of the profound muscle hypertrophy characteristic of macroglossia in the Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome, a compelling need exists for surgical reduction of the tongue as early in life as possible
This report describes our clinical experience with 3 children, 1 referred late and the other 2 treated within the first year of life
